lines.text: You've heard of Carrie White, haven't you?
Supposedly, she set the fire as some sort of revenge-suicide thing, Elvis was her date and they escaped in a UFO.
Please. Don't leave me. I don't have anyone. Please, God... let me die.

[to Jesse]
I always wanted to be one of the shiny, happy people.
Doesn't it bother you that some girl offed herself?
No. It's not like she was anybody.
What?
I mean, I didn't know her.
He's just letting little Jesse do the thinking for big Jesse.
I had a traumatic experience in high school. I tried to help someone, and it backfired horribly.
We're missing a real killer party.
I think I split her in two.
Sue, are you sure you aren't still trying to save a girl who died twenty years ago?
He should get some more points because she's so skanky.
[after getting hit with eggs by the opposing school's football players driving by in a truck]
Why do the innocent always get hit in a drive-by?
I don't think that I believe in it.
Believe in what?
Love.
Then you have bigger problems than passing this class.
You know, Tracy isn't universally loved. She tried to steal Brad from me. She's a Melrose Place superbitch.
Is that all I was to you, Jesse? Thirty points?
We're all friends here - we're all friends!
No - we just grew up together.
[Chuck walks up to and tapes Lisa's dead body laying on a car]
Oh man! Whose car is this?
